greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n, d odd} mu(d) * mu(n/d).
comment: All terms are 0 or +/- a power of 2. - _Robert Israel_, Nov 26 2019
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x) = x - Sum_{k>=2} A001227(k) * A(x^k).
Multiplicative with a(2^e) = -1 if e = 1, and 0 if e > 1, and a(p^e) = -2 if e = 1, 1 if e = 2, and 0 if e > 2, for an odd prime p. - _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 25 2020
mathematica: a[n_] := If[n == 1, n, -Sum[If[d < n, DivisorSum[n/d, Mod[#, 2] &] a[d], 0], {d, Divisors[n]}]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 79}]
f[p_, e_] := Which[e == 1, -1 - Boole[p > 2], e == 2, Boole[p > 2], e > 2, 0]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ (f @@@ FactorInteger[n]); Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 25 2020 *)
program: (MAGMA) [&+[MoebiusMu(d)*MoebiusMu(n div d): d in [a:a in Divisors(n)| IsOdd(a)]]:n in [1..80]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Sep 15 2019
(PARI) a(n)={sumdiv(n, d, if(d%2, moebius(d)*moebius(n/d)))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 23 2019
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 15 2019
